description:
The Legal Online Operations team is responsible for improving efficiency and scalability through training, development and quality assurance for all levels of teams and vendors globally.

Our team is the point of contact for maintaining the knowledge base for all policies and documentation processes, training and development of team members and vendors from onboarding to departure at scale, assessing and helping the team to identify, maintain or improve quality consistently.

As part of this team you'll work closely with teams leads to determine where training or improved documentation can help teams to scale to meet business needs, reduce risks with quality controls, and increase efficiency.

Our team focuses on onboarding, career development programs, maintaining a single knowledge base, and ensuring quality standards are consistently assessed and improved. We work closely with teams to determine where training or improved documentation can help teams scale to meet business needs, reduce legal risks with quality controls, and increase efficiency.

You're detail oriented and can work on several competing projects simultaneously. You'll support project timelines, roadmaps and calendars across all projects. You have experience creating transparent prioritization processes to ensure that roadmaps meet business needs/risks. You'll be the point of intake for requests, ensuring all projects are transparently prioritized and communicated to stakeholders.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience in operations, program management or documentation.
  • Experience in improving and identifying issues in processes, suggesting user focused improvements, and prioritizing and supporting improvement projects.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 3 years of experience with vendor management.
  • Excellent knowledge of and experience with G Suite products.
  • Project management focus, with the ability to manage projects and be accountable for results.
  • Creative self-starter, with ability to proactively identify opportunities to streamline processes.
  • Demonstrated attention to detail and commitment to produce high-quality work.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate and persuade.
responsibilities:
• Maintain department calendars for project timelines, communication of status and changes in priorities.
  • Be a point of intake for project requests and ensure they are assigned to the appropriate team members.
  • Manage communications and information to and from Legal Operations team members.
  • Support vendor and resource needs for knowledge base, training and quality assessment projects.
  • Determine what dashboards and sites are needed to keep stakeholders informed and engaged in key projects.
title: Operations Specialist, Training and Documentation
